Title: Despite N7tr subsidy savings, states fail to cushion hardship, hunger
Summary: Despite N7tr subsidy savings, states fail to cushion hardship, hunger . Federal Government may have saved at least N7 trillion, but the unintended consequences have not been seen . President Bola Tinubu’s May 2023 decision to end subsidies on premium motor spirit (petrol)

Title: PDP postpones NEC meeting amid uncertainty over action against Atiku, Wike
Summary: PDP postpones NEC meeting amid uncertainty over action against Atiku, Wike . Concerns over whether party's top decision-making body can take decisive action . PDP has postponed its 99th National Executive Committee (NEC) meeting .

Title: North holds key to solving Nigeria’s problems, says Obi
Summary: Peter Obi declared that Northern Nigeria holds the key to solving the nation's deepest challenges . Presidential candidate of the Labour Party (LP) in the 2023 elections, Peter Obi, declared that the North holds key to the nation’s problems, says Obi .

Title: Nwokobia, Adebayo blast APC’s ‘fear-driven’ strategy, urge Tinubu to govern
Summary: Lawyer and public affairs analyst, Chris Nwokobia has said the All Progressives Congress (APC) is jittery; hence, its craving for endorsements . The lawyer has described the APC’s ‘fear-driven’ strategy, urge Tinubu to govern .

Title: JAMB’s examination errors: Restoring confidence beyond the uproar
Summary: The public apprehension and anxiety occasioned by the recent system error recorded by the Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board (JAMB) signposts a major test to the board and the credibility of Nigeria’s examinations processes .

Title: Diamond League: Tobi Amusan sets new 100m record in Rabat
Summary: Nigerian hurdler and world record holder Tobi Amusan stormed to victory in the women’s 100 meters hurdles at the Diamond League meet in Rabat, Morocco, clocking an impressive 12.45 seconds .

Title: Herders shoot Catholic priest, kidnap 2 others in Benue
Summary: Catholic priest in charge of St. John Quasi Parish, Jimba, Rev. Fr. Solomon Atongu was reportedly shot by suspected armed herdsmen . The priest was reportedly killed along the Makurdi–Naka Road .

Title: Hardship: How poor families bribe ways into parties just to feed
Summary: A few years ago, one could walk into a party as an invited or uninvited guest, eat, drink and even go home with bags full of varieties of food, if he or she wishes . The post Hardship: How poor families bribe ways into parties just to feed .

Title: 2027: Tinubu’s endorsements fake, not what Nigerians want — Atiku, PDP
Summary: Former Vice President Atiku Abubakar and the PDP dismiss recent endorsements for President Bola Tinubu by governors and stakeholders of the All Progressives Congress, APC, calling them a sign of panic and desperation .

Title: Nigeria reviews trade strategies, investment climate to enhance competitiveness
Summary: The Federal Government has begun a review of Nigeria’s trade and investment strategies along with infrastructure planning . The review was done at an Economic Management Team (EMT) session which was chaired by the Minister of Finance .

Title: Dikko blames Gateway Games power outage on technical glitch
Summary: The power outage occurred during the men’s 10,000m final of the 2024 National Sports Festival at the MKO Abiola Sports Complex on Saturday was caused by a technical glitch . The stadium was thrown into darkness midway through the event, and it lasted for about 20 minutes as athletes completed the race in the dark . Plateau

Title: ‎Trump slams 'crazy' Putin as Russia pummels Ukraine with massive drone attack
Summary: At least 13 people were killed when Russia launched a record number of drones against Ukraine overnight to Sunday . US President Donald Trump called his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin “crazy” on Sunday after Moscow launched a deadly barrage of drones . The US leader expressed increasing frustration with Moscow’s position in deadlocked truce negotiations with Kyiv .

Title: PICTORIAL: Katsina gov visits injured security officers
Summary: Katsina State Governor, Dikko Radda, on Sunday, paid a visit to the Federal Medical Centre in Katsina, where he checked on members of the Community Watch Corps, who were injured during a recent bandit attack in Marhaba village, Matazu Local Government Area .

Title: NDPHC decries N600bn electricity debt, stranded 2,000MW
Summary: Management of Niger Delta Power Holding Company says the Nigeria Bulk Electricity Trading Plc and other bilateral entities are owing NDPHC close to N600bn, thereby hindering the company’s operations . The company decried what it called the dismal uptake of electricity from the electricity market, saying this is significantly weighing down its operations .

Title: NIGERIAN PLAYERS ABROAD: Iwobi makes Premier League history in season finales
Summary: Nigerian footballers wrapped up their 2024/25 European football season with memorable performances across the continent . Ola Aina came off the bench for Nottingham Forest in their 1–0 home defeat to Chelsea . Alex Iwobi became the first Nigerian player to appear in all 38 Premier League matches in a season on two separate occasions .
